lawnlayer

Class GameObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • lawnlayer.GameObject
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Agent, TileObject

    public class GameObject
extends java.lang.Object
    The base class for all game objects.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GameObject(int x, int y)
      Create a game object with specified (x,y) coordinates.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      Checks if a sprite is set for this game object.

      Removes the sprite for this game object.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameObject

        public GameObject(int x,
                  int y)
        Create a game object with specified (x,y) coordinates. The coordinates are set as the center of a tile, instead of top-left.
        Parameters:
        x - x-coordinate
        y - y-coordinate

    • Method Detail

      • setSprite

        public void setSprite(processing.core.PImage sprite)
        Sets the sprite for this game object.
        Parameters:
        sprite - the sprite image in PImage

      • isSpriteSet

        public boolean isSpriteSet()
        Checks if a sprite is set for this game object.
        Returns:
        true if set, otherwise false

      • removeSprite

        public void removeSprite()
        Removes the sprite for this game object.

      • draw

        public void draw(processing.core.PApplet app)
        Draws the sprite of this game object on screen. The sprite is always drawn from the top-left corner of tile.

        x coordinate = x - App.SPRITESIZE() / 2
        y coordinate = y - App.SPRITESIZE() / 2

        Parameters:
        app - the base class app of PApplet

      • getX

        public int getX()
        Gets the x-coordinate of this game object.
        Returns:
        x-coordinate as an integer

      • getY

        public int getY()
        Gets the y-coordinate of this game object.
        Returns:
        y-coordinate as an integer

      • setX

        public void setX(int x)
        Sets the x-coordinate of this game object.
        Parameters:
        x - the integer x-coordinate to be set

      • setY

        public void setY(int y)
        Sets the y-coordinate of this game object.
        Parameters:
        y - the integer y-coordinate to be set
